alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 08 at 10:15AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Cheyenne. * WHEN...From 4 PM MDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Cheyenne County has already received around two to four inches of rainfall the previous few days. Additional heavy rainfall will only serve to further exacerbate the already saturated ground conditions. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
